intro: Panicum sanguinale var. fenestratum, commonly known as the fenestrated bloodgrass, is a striking ornamental grass native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and its distinctive, narrow leaves with a reddish hue that deepens during the growing season. The plant produces fluffy, pinkish-white seed heads that add visual interest in the late summer and autumn. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its unique foliage and seasonal color changes make it a valuable addition to botanical collections and ornamental horticulture.
